intro: Maoutia rigida, commonly known as the rigid maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Maoutia rigida is often found in humid, shaded environments within its native habitat.
